results.title: Building of the earth
results.brief_description: Examines volcanic action and plate tectonics, the extreme cold of polar and high altitude regions, and how living organisms have adapted those environments. Teachers advised to view in advance so that segments may be identified as appropriate to concentration spans.

results.title: Talkback radio with John Pearce
results.brief_description: Former Sydney Broadcaster John Pearce discusses his views on the relationship between talk-back radio and radio programming. Within his role as a talk-back radio host, he says he needed to remain in control of the calls and scored points off the callers as necessary in the interests of a high rating show. Interviewed by Bryon Quigley. No other credits available.

results.title: Up against it
results.creator_credit: Cath Cantlon and Henley Beach Mural Collective
results.brief_description: A documentary on the painting of a large mural on a sea wall at Adelaide’s Henley Beach. Shows the design considerations, research, the process of involving the local council and school students, and the preparation and painting of the wall.

results.title: Salamanders
results.creator_credit: Madeline McLaughlin and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: David Suzuki outlines the amazing diversity of salamanders, their ability to regenerate limbs, to clone themselves and to adapt physically (both internally and externally) to their environment.

results.title: Room for one more
results.creator_credit: Barry Milligan and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Victoria Templeton interviews couples who have adopted or fostered disabled children in infancy or early childhood. Discusses the joys and issues surrounding caring for emotionally, physically or intellectually disabled children and emphasises the importance of family relationships.

results.title: Punching keys
results.creator_credit: Sally Ingleton and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A biting dramatisation of the effects of the new technology in deskilling the female office workforce, alienating women from the products of their labour, and rendering them replaceable by cheaper labour overseas. Cast includes a young Gina Riley.

results.title: Pine Gap images
results.brief_description: A celebrations of documented images of the women’s protest camp at Pine Gap, Australian Northern Territory in November 1983. A series of images representing the feeling of some of the women acting for qualitative change and for world peace. A discussion starter about non-violent protest action.

results.title: Planning a programme
results.creator_credit: Mike Crisp, Harris Watts and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: An introduction to the basic techniques of recording an event on camera. In the first section a humorous dramatization of a retirement ceremony shows how not to do it. The second section shows how these mistakes can be easily avoided by proper research and planning. A series of graphics is used to demostrate how the program-makers can organize the positioning of camera, lights and participants well in advance of filming. The tape ends with a shorter, punchier, much improved version of thr ceremony.
